channel.title: Quin7et's Personal Website
channel.description: Recent content on Quin7et's Personal Website

item.title: Vitalis District Devlog
item.description: Vitalis District One level I’ve always loved in Dishonored 1 is the Flooded District. It is quite a cliche to take away the player’s arsonal towards the 3rd act of the game, but it is equally effective and facinating to me, which is why I’m saddened such moment was never present in Dishonored 2 (Well, maybe A Crack In the Slab, but the time piece is arguably a better power).

item.title: Virginia: Perfect In form, Lost In Spirit
item.description: Preamble Eurogamer’s review of Thirty Flights of Loving states: “This is a game that packs more narrative punch into its first startling jump-cut than most can muster across an entire campaign.” Virginia, unfortunately, falls into the latter. Despite its effort to become Thirty Flight’s “full-length successor,” an overt ending credit tribute would not save Virginia from being a drawn-out, vapid hollow of its predecessor. Because of Virginia’s self-identification as an interactive movie rather than a game, it naturally fails to live up to Thirty Flight’s name - to push beyond the boundary of video game narrative techniques.

item.title: Things I Learned From the GMTK Game Jam
item.description: That’s when I realized, I was trying to make an IMPRESSIVE game, rather than a FUN one (which probably says a lot about my insecurities). I am NOT known for actually finishing my projects. Contrary to popular belief, creativity is NOT a rare talent. It’s not even a minority trait. Literally everyone is able to come up with an abundance of ideas, some of which are actually quite practical and executable.

item.title: About
item.description: I am Quin “Quin7et” Li, a level designer/indie dev. I made Campfire for Ludum Dare 50. I translated this Devil Daggers guide by Braden. I have translated a few entries (into Chinese) on the SCP Foundation. I wrote a short fiction published on Science Fiction World when I was 17. You’ve probably noticed that I didn’t link it. The reason being that I am not proud of it. I enjoy science fictions that don’t involve space (or at least don’t make a big deal of it).

item.title: How To Learn Anything (Probably)
item.description: Disclaimer: I am in no way a psychiatrist or an expert at cognitive science. All of the following content are my personal methodologies + things I’ve learned from my closest friends (and they are all REALLY good learners!). I am also not the fastest nor the best learner; but what I AM good at is explaining things to dummies like myself. So if you want something easy to read and potentially quite helpful, continue reading!
